item.title: Damaged Kerbstone, 22nd July
item.description:
On Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath - opposite Bexleyheath Police Station: The Council outlined in green spray paint a kerbstone on the pavement which is loose and is a trip hazard to pedestrians many months ago however no action has been taken to repair or replace it. Please see the attached picture. Could you please chase your contractor to do something about it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arnsberg Way, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Can pavement here be inspected?, 22nd July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Salisbury Road, Southborough, London

item.title: Graffiti, 22nd July
item.description:
On Arnsberg Way, Bexleyheath - opposite Cobans Kitchen restaurant: Please could you remove the black graffiti from the blue doors beside the pavement as seen in the attached picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arnsberg Way, Barnehurst, London

item.title: Street light out, 22nd July
item.description:
This is the street light outside the Sanjugo restaurant, at the end of Hugh Street on the crossroads with Cambridge St. It has been out for a few days and this is a dark cul-de-sac which needs light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44, Hugh Street, Victoria, London

item.title: Huge rats roaming around, 21st July
item.description:
Extremely large rats roaming around the grass area. Council not taking action against pest problem which has been an issue for years. Cannot walk across the common anymore without huge rats scavenging across in broad daylight.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Road, West Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noise, and fire hazard from business, 21st July
item.description:
There is some kind of scrapyard here. People are working on cars up to 11 or nearly midnight pretty much every day.There is rubbish piled up here and behind the church hall which is a massive fire hazard. Is it even a legal business?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lamb Lane, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
